snippet: The display of Palestinian unity was largely intended to inspire confidence ahead of an international donors’ conference for the reconstruction of Gaza.
abstract: Palestinian Prime Min Rami Hamdallah convenes first meeting of cabinet in Gaza in move meant to signal more involvement of West Bank-based Palestinian Authority in running enclave after seven years of control by Hamas; display of Palestinian unity is largely intended to inspire confidence ahead of an international donors’ conference for the reconstruction of Gaza.

byline.original: By FARES AKRAM and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Fares Akram reported from Gaza, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: The display of Palestinian unity was largely intended to inspire confidence ahead of an international donors’ conference for the reconstruction of Gaza.

headline.main: After Years of Hamas Control, Gaza Is Scene of Palestinian Cabinet Meeting
headline.print_headline: After Years of Hamas Control, Gaza Is Scene of Palestinian Cabinet Meeting
